result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter S. Scheibel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:20am [mo]
Defendant Peter S. Scheibel in court.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews the Court Record

Upon inquiry of the Court, Mr. Scheibel indicates that he still wishes to represent himself.
  

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Beck

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions outlined in the Criminal Case Settlement form.

[which are:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to provide DNA sample
--pay statutory costs]

The Court orders Mr. Scheibel to JESO to submit his DNA, today.


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 10:43am
Court's Response - The Court concluded based on the signed CCS, that the hearing on March 24, 2016 at 9:15 am will be converted to a plea and sentencing hearing - Judge Wambach
from ADA Teuber enclosing a signed Criminal Case Settlement form
JA Strike will set a date/time ASAP for the Motion to Be heard
Court's Review of the State's  Response to the Court's Scheduling Order
Motion hearing on March 24, 2016 at 09:15 am.
States notice of intent to admit statements made by the defendant
State's response to Court's scheduling order

Case called at 10:43 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Peter S. Scheibel in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; No victim in this file - Court so finds
Court previously found that Mr. Scheibel was competent to represent himself & waived his right to counsel - further reviews case filings
Mr. Scheibel informs the Court that he appeared at PTC and had meaningful PTC with State
Mr. Scheibel informs the Court that he would like some time so he could complete an AODA assessment
Court informs Mr. Scheibel that he may complete this while waiting for trial date.
Parties agree this will be 1 day trial; ADA Teuber indicates that they have not yet received report so testing has not been completed
Court informs ADA Teuber that whoever does the testing is to be available for trial date set
Deputy present in courtroom provides parties with scheduling order - Mr. Scheibel indicates he has no questions re: order
Recess: 10:50 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule FSSC 4/4/16 at 1:00 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 4/7/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 2:43pm [mo]
Defendant Peter S. Scheibel in court.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Mr. Scheibel indicates he was present when the Court gave another Defendant their right to Counsel and understands his rights
--Mr Scheibel indicates that he does not wish to have counsel at this time
The Court finds Mr. Scheibel competent to represent himself. The Court finds that Mr. Scheibel is knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to counsel. 
The Court enters a Plea of "not guilty" on Mr. Scheibel's behalf; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $1000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--No Contact with Kahyil Humbach
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess: 2:51pm


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 12/9/15 at 9:20am   (2)  Status Conference on 1/26/16 at 10:30am
